intro: Leptorkis wrayi, commonly known as the Wray's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are erect and covered in fine hairs. Leptorkis wrayi is adapted to arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant characteristics that allow it to thrive in semi-desert regions.
